pages.title: Grypania
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Paleoproterozoic (Orosirian) - Neoproterozoic (Ediacaran)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Marine$(br2)Domain:$(br)>$(o)incertae sedis(br2)$(l)Propagation:$() Craft with a bucket of water.$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Grypania is an extremely early, tube shaped fossil from the Proterozoic Eon. It could have been a bacterial colony or a eukaryotic alga. The time range for this taxon extended for around 1200 million years due to the oldest probable Grypania being dated to 1870 mya.
